archetype_name: Family Extra-Hot Chili Night (Caribbean & Mexican, 15–30, Simple)
name: Extra-Hot Jerk Pork & Pineapple Grill over Mexican-Style Spanish Rice
description: Habanero-and-allspice–rubbed pork shoulder grilled with pineapple, served over quick, tomato-scented Spanish rice. Fiery, fast, and family-friendly to plate.
prep_steps: Cut pork shoulder into 2–3 cm cubes; pat dry.
Dice half the pineapple into 2–3 cm chunks; save the rest for snacking or garnish.
Finely chop garlic and 1–2 habanero peppers (use gloves).
Measure spanish rice, diced tomatoes, and chicken stock.
Preheat outdoor grill to medium-high (or heat a grill pan) and set a saucepan on the stovetop.
cook_steps: In a bowl, mix pork shoulder with olive oil, allspice, salt, black pepper, chopped garlic, and chopped habanero peppers; squeeze in lime juice and toss. Thread onto skewers if using.
Toss pineapple chunks with a little olive oil.
Start rice: add olive oil to the saucepan over medium heat; sauté diced onion 2 minutes. Stir in spanish rice to toast 1 minute.
Add diced tomatoes and chicken stock to the rice; bring to a simmer, cover, and cook on low until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender (about 12–15 minutes).
Grill pork (and pineapple) over direct heat, turning occasionally, until pork is cooked through with charred edges and pineapple is caramelized, about 8–10 minutes.
Fluff the rice. Taste and adjust salt.
Plate rice, top with grilled pork and pineapple. Squeeze extra lime over everything to serve.
